content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: UN report flags JeM role in Delhi Red Fort blast; warns of Masood Azhar‚Äôs women-only terror wing
content: A UN Security Council report has implicated Jaish-e-Mohammed in a car bombing near Delhi's Red Fort last November, which claimed 15 lives. The outfit's leader, Masood Azhar, reportedly established a women's wing to aid terror attacks. Investigations into the incident revealed a 'white-collar' terror module, leading to several arrests.

title: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: Tobacco baron's son Shivam arrested 4 days after VIP Road rampage
content: Shivam Mishra, son of tobacco baron K K Mishra, was arrested in connection with a fatal Lamborghini crash on Kanpur's VIP Road. The arrest followed the dismissal of his driver's surrender application, with the court noting Shivam was the accused. The court also directed Shivam to cooperate with the vehicle's technical examination.

title: Bangladesh: Day before polls, two Hindu men brutally killed in seperate incidents
content: Two Hindu men were killed in separate incidents in Bangladesh ahead of Thursday's elections. A tea worker was found dead with his hands and feet tied in Moulvibazar, while a rice trader was hacked to death in his shop in Mymensingh. The International Crisis Group has warned of further attacks.

title: 'I quit, as ChatGPT-maker...': Top researcher Zoe Hitzig at Sam Altman's company
content: OpenAI's top researcher Zoe Hitzig resigned, citing concerns over the company's decision to test ads in ChatGPT. She warned that the vast trove of private user data collected by ChatGPT could be exploited for manipulation, drawing parallels to Facebook's past privacy issues. Hitzig proposed alternative models for AI companies to avoid such pitfalls.

title: ‚ÄòWorst of the worst criminal aliens‚Äô: 21 Gujaratis included among 89 Indians on US list
content: A US Homeland Security list of "worst of the worst" criminal aliens includes 21 Gujaratis, primarily involved in financial crimes like money laundering and fraud targeting elderly citizens. The list also features individuals convicted of sexual offenses against minors, drug trafficking, and dealing in stolen property, highlighting organized criminal activity linked to illegal migration from Gujarat.

title: ‚ÄòWe have got one more day‚Äô: Tilak Varma shares big Abhishek, Bumrah fitness update
content: Tilak Varma provided positive fitness updates on Abhishek Sharma, who has been discharged from the hospital after a stomach infection, and Jasprit Bumrah, who is recovering well. Final decisions on their availability for the upcoming match against Namibia will be made closer to game time. The team is also preparing for their high-voltage encounter against Pakistan.

title: After Microsoft power warning, Trump may seek AI pact with big tech
content: The US government is proposing a voluntary pact with tech giants like Google and Meta to manage the booming AI data centre energy demands. Companies would commit to covering all new power generation costs, ensuring no rise in household electricity prices, and addressing water usage and local community impacts. This initiative aims to prevent grid strain and protect consumers.

title: Man Utd owner says UK 'colonised' by immigrants; Brit PM demands apology
content: Sir Jim Ratcliffe‚Äôs remarks that Britain has been ‚Äúcolonised by immigrants‚Äù detonated far beyond a single interview because they landed at the fault line of modern British politics. Linking immigration, welfare and national decline, the Monaco-based Manchester United co-owner used loaded language and shaky numbers that triggered backlash from politicians, supporters and campaigners. Yet the episode also revealed a deeper truth: immigration anxiety now drives the UK‚Äôs political mood, fuelling the rise of Reform and hollowing out Labour‚Äôs popularity. When an establishment insider says this out loud, it signals how far the Overton window has already shifted.

title: A year after 5-day office mandate, some JPMorgan staff fear ‚Äòcareer‚Äô petition
content: America's largest bank mandated a five-day return to office in March 2025, sparking an employee petition and internal backlash. CEO Jamie Dimon dismissed the petition, emphasizing the policy's necessity for clients and the company, despite acknowledging remote work's potential for some roles and individuals.

title: 'Stabbed them repeatedly': US-returned Bengaluru techie kills parents in villa over startup funding
content: A US-returned techie, Rohan Chandra Bhat, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his parents in their Bengaluru villa. Driven by desperation to fund his new venture, Rohan reportedly stabbed his retired navy captain father and dentist mother after heated arguments over financial support. Neighbours alerted authorities, but the couple was declared dead at the hospital.

title: Watch: Major brawl erupts in Turkey parliament; lawmakers trade punches
content: A violent clash erupted in Turkey's parliament as opposition lawmakers attempted to prevent the swearing-in of a controversial judicial minister. The incident occurred during a cabinet reshuffle, with legislators seen pushing and punching each other. The new appointments come amid ongoing constitutional reform debates and peace initiatives.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,900; BSE Sensex down over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Indian stock market indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, tanked in opening trade on Thursday morning. While Nifty50 went below 25,900, BSE Sensex was down over 200 points.

title: Bharat Bandh today: Which sectors will be hit and why trade unions are protesting
content: Over 10 central trade unions, farmer organisations, and Left parties called for a 12-hour Bharat Bandh on Thursday, protesting against the Centre's alleged anti-worker, anti-farmer, and pro-corporate policies. The strike, supported by the Samyukt Kisan Morcha, aimed to oppose new labor codes, the Indo-US trade agreement, and changes to MGNREGA, with an estimated 30 crore workers participating across India.

title: 'Trying to isolate over 100m users': Russia blocks WhatsApp ‚Äî will the ban be reversed?
content: Russia attempted to block WhatsApp and Telegram, aiming to promote domestic platforms and increase internet control. WhatsApp stated this move would isolate over 100 million users, potentially reducing safety. This action follows disputes with foreign tech firms after the Ukraine invasion, with Russia pushing its own surveillance app, MAX.

title: Bumrah yorker hits Ishan, Sanju Samson on standby for Abhishek
content: Jasprit Bumrah showed good form in training, boosting hopes for his return against Namibia. Ishan Kishan faced a brief scare after being hit by a Bumrah yorker but resumed batting. Sanju Samson is in contention if Abhishek Sharma's stomach infection persists. Washington Sundar also trained well. The team is preparing for the Pakistan clash.

title: 'Gave poisoned laddoos': How ‚Äòmystical healer‚Äô preyed on greed and left a trail of deaths in Delhi
content: A 72-year-old occultist, Kamruddin, has been arrested for allegedly poisoning three people with laddoos in Delhi. Cops describe him as a habitual offender with a criminal history in Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan, including at least two prior murder cases. He preyed on victims by promising mystical solutions and wealth, extorting money before administering poison.

title: Erika Kirk addresses backlash as Bad Bunny‚Äôs show outshines TPUSA event
content: Erika Kirk spoke out after Turning Point USA aired its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show honoring her late husband, Charlie Kirk. The broadcast featured a tribute montage and patriotic performances, claiming millions of viewers despite streaming restrictions. While Bad Bunny headlined the official NFL show, the rival event blended politics, grief, and culture into a deeply emotional night.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan ahead of Olympic opener
content: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle‚Äôs Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year‚Äôs international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Bangladesh polls: Why India is watching closely
content: Bangladesh votes Thursday in an election with significant implications for India. With Sheikh Hasina out, India hopes the frontrunner BNP can reset ties, despite historical friction. A tight contest is expected between the BNP alliance and a bloc led by Jamaat-e-Islami. India also eyes a constitutional referendum and key security concerns, including insurgent groups and Chinese influence.

title: Knicks vs 76ers injury report: Who‚Äôs playing, out and questionable
content: The Knicks and 76ers clash on February 11, 2026, impacting Eastern Conference standings. New York, near the top, faces Philadelphia battling for playoff positioning. Both teams are hampered by injuries, with key players like OG Anunoby out for the Knicks and Joel Embiid a game-time decision for the 76ers. This crucial matchup could hinge on depth and rebounding.

title: How to book Emirates flights at lower fares in 2026: Best time for booking cheapest tickets
content: Emirates' busiest January for family travel highlights the advantage of early booking. Travel experts advise booking 2-3 months ahead, especially for Economy and leveraging mid-week travel. Utilising Emirates' Low Fare Calendar and considering off-peak seasons can secure better deals. Loyalty programs and promo codes offer additional savings for savvy travellers.

title: From IND vs PAK in 2007 to AFG vs SA in 2026: All tied matches in T20 World Cup
content: South Africa secured a dramatic victory over Afghanistan in a thrilling double super over T20 World Cup encounter. After both teams tied at 187 in regulation and again in the first super over, South Africa ultimately prevailed in the second sudden-death showdown. Afghanistan's hopes were dashed when Rahmanullah Gurbaz was caught off the final ball.

title: Can your home withstand earthquake? How materials are impacting building durability
content: Ancient Indian construction techniques, utilizing natural materials like lime mortar and jaggery, are experiencing a resurgence in modern real estate. This blend of old and new enhances structural safety and durability, crucial as 61% of India faces moderate to high seismic hazards. Luxury homebuyers are leading this trend, seeking sustainable and long-lasting homes.

title: ICC T20 World Cup 2026: Full match schedule for February 12
content: The T20 World Cup heats up on February 12 with Sri Lanka facing Oman, Nepal taking on Italy, and India battling Namibia. Sri Lanka, despite Hasaranga's injury, aims for another win. Nepal, buoyed by a near-upset against England, meets Italy. India, after defeating USA, faces Namibia with opener Sharma a doubt, potentially seeing Samson open.

title: James Van Der Beek passes away at 48 after battle with colorectal cancer
content: US actor James Van Der Beek, the star of the American TV series "Dawson's Creek," died on Wednesday at age 48 after a battle with colorectal cancer.  While he also had roles in the films "Varsity Blues" and "The Rules of Attraction," Van Der Beek never truly established himself in cinema as he struggled to separate himself from the legacy of "Dawson's Creek."

title: Woman constable ditches cop fiance hours before wedding, elopes with history-sheeter
content: A constable's wedding plans were disrupted when she vanished the night before her marriage. Her father alleged abduction by a history-sheeter. However, the bride was found and stated she left on her own. The groom has called off the wedding. The bride remains firm in her decision. She will be produced before a court.

title: Happy Hug Day 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes for your special someone
content: The article offers over 75 messages, quotes, and greetings for partners, friends, family, and long-distance loved ones, highlighting hugs as a powerful, simple way to express care and make others feel cherished.

title: 'Border 2' box office Day 20 and Day 21 (LIVE): Sunny starrer beats Rs 432 crore mark globally
content: 'Border 2', which kicked off with an impressive bang during the Republic Day celebrations, is now seeing a decline in its box office draw as it enters week three. Despite the stirring performance of Sunny Deol and a hefty total of Rs 316 crore in India, totaling Rs 432.1 crore globally, recent ticket sales reflect a waning interest among audiences.

title: US-Israel meeting: Trump backs Iran talks, warns Tehran citing 'Midnight Hammer'
content: US President Donald Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, emphasizing the need for continued negotiations with Iran on a nuclear deal. Trump warned Tehran of severe consequences if talks falter, referencing past US military actions. The leaders also addressed the Gaza conflict and broader Middle East instability, with international calls for restraint amid regional tensions.

title: Bihar ‚Äòpakadua vivah‚Äô: Student kidnapped by friends, drugged, forced into marriage
content: In a shocking incident from Samastipur, a 22-year-old student named Nitish Kumar was said to have been drugged and abducted by those he considered acquaintances. For two harrowing days, he was reportedly held against his will after being sedated.

title: Look forward to getting more new-gen jets: IAF vice chief
content: The Indian Air Force is looking to induct more multi-role fighter aircraft, with Rafale being a strong contender, as stated by Air Marshal Nagesh Kapoor. This comes ahead of a Defence Acquisition Council meeting that may clear deals for Rafale jets and P-8I aircraft.

title: Fast break: Pair of Kings worth stashing before All-Star break
content: the Detroit Pistons outlasted the Charlotte Hornets in a game defined by chaos and controversy . Isaiah Stewart 's eighth career' penned the latest entry to his r√©sum√©, tying Russell Westbrook for the most home triple-doubles in league history . the Thunder exposed the Los Angeles Lakers' inconsistency when they are without Luka Doncic .

title: US To Start Payments Towards Billions Owed To UN 'Within Weeks': Envoy
content: Washington will begin making initial payments towards the billions of dollars it owes the United Nations "within weeks", while continuing to push for reforms, the US ambassador to the UN said.

title: Hyderabad-Bound Gulf Air Flight Gets Bomb Threat Minutes After Takeoff
content: An e-mail received on Wednesday threatened a blast at the Hyderabad airport when a Gulf Air flight from Bahrain lands, according to sources.

title: Czech Woman Tourist Assaulted In Goa, Accused Arrested
content: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly assaulting a woman tourist from the Czech Republic at Agonda Beach in Goa's Kushavati district, police said on Thursday.

title: S Korea Fines Louis Vuitton, Dior, Tiffany $24.9 Million Over Data Leaks
content: South Korea's privacy watchdog said on Thursday it has fined the Korean units of luxury brands Louis Vuitton, Dior and Tiffany a combined 36 billion won ($24.9 million) over leaks of customer information.

title: Drugs Worth Rs 3.43 Crore Seized By Customs At Bengaluru Airport
content: The Bengaluru Customs officials have announced that narcotic substances worth over Rs 3.43 crore were seized at the Kempegowda International Airport in two separate incidents.

title: Donald Trump Praises Trade Deal With India, Calls It "Historic"
content: US President Donald Trump said that the United States is the world's leading energy producer, emphasising the nation is becoming a "massive energy exporter."

title: Canada School Killer, 18-Year-Old Trans Woman, First Shot Mother, Step-Brother At Home
content: Canada Shooter Jesse Van Rootselaar: An 18-year-old trans woman with mental health issues has been identified as the killer behind the deadly shooting in British Columbia, Canada, that resulted in nine deaths.

title: Bangladesh Election 2026 LIVE: Clashes Reported Between Jamaat, BNP Supporters In Dhaka As Bangladesh Votes
content: Bangladesh Election 2026 Voting Live Updates: Bangladeshi is voting today in a crucial national election, the first since the July 2024 uprising that ended former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's 15 years of iron-fisted rule.

title: Jamaat, BNP Supporters Clash In Dhaka As Bangladesh Votes: 10 Updates
content: Clashes have been reported between Jamaat and Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) supporters in Mirpur-10 Constituency in Dhaka. Jamaat-e-Islami chief Shafiqur Rahman is contesting from this seat. Voting is underway on 299 seats in Bangladesh.

title: Video: Excavator Machine Operator Tries To Strike Indore Man Amid Argument
content: A heated roadside argument escalated into a deadly attack carried at a Metro site in Indore when a Poclain excavator became a weapon in the fight.

title: UN Report Flags Jaish-e-Mohammed Link To Red Fort Attack, Warns of New Women's Terror Wing
content: A United Nations counter-terrorism monitoring team has named Pakistan-based terror group Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) as being linked to a deadly attack at Delhi's historic Red Fort.

title: Gates Foundation Says It Did Not Make Any Payments To Jeffrey Epstein
content: The Gates Foundation said it did not make any financial payments to late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein or employ him at any time.

title: Why Some Animals Are Still Labelled As Primitive Though None Exist
content: We humans have long viewed ourselves as the pinnacle of evolution. People label other species as "primitive" or "ancient" and use terms like "higher" and "lower" animals.

title: Hindu Man Killed In Bangladesh On Election Eve, Hands And Legs Were Tied
content: A 28-year-old Hindu man was found dead with visible injury marks on his body in Moulvibazar district in Bangladesh on Wednesday, a day before crucial voting, triggering fresh concerns among minorities about election violence.

title: World Health Body Urges US To Share Covid Origins Intel
content: The World Health Organization on Wednesday urged Washington to share any intelligence it may be withholding on the Covid-19 pandemic's origins, despite the United States quitting the WHO.

title: Salman Khan's Brother-In-Law Gets Threat Email, Sender Claims Bishnoi Link
content: Mumbai Police's crime branch is investigating a threat email that was sent to Bollywood superstar Salman Khan's brother-in-law and actor Aayush Sharma a few months back.

title: US Top Official In Venezuela For Oil Talks After Maduro's Ouster
content: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright was in Venezuela for talks with acting president Delcy Rodriguez and oil industry executives on harnessing the country's vast reserves of crude.

title: WhatsApp, With 100 Million Users In Russia, Claims Moscow Tried To Block It
content: Russia has attempted to "fully block" Meta Platforms-owned WhatsApp in the country, a company spokesperson told Reuters, as it promotes home-grown platforms and seeks greater control over its internet space.

title: Many ICE Agents Were Arrested In Recent Months, Showing Risk Of Misconduct
content: Investigators said one immigration enforcement official got away with physically assaulting his girlfriend for years. Another admitted he repeatedly sexually abused a woman in his custody.

title: BMW Recalls Hundreds Of Thousands Of Cars Over Fire Risk
content: German carmaker BMW is to recall hundreds of thousands of cars worldwide over a potential risk of engine starters sparking a fire, a company spokesman confirmed to AFP.

title: What we're most excited to see in 2026: Games, players and more
content: the big Ten has regained its place as the top conference in college football after winning three consecutive national championships . the 2025 college football season culminated with a thrilling College Football Playoff and a national title for undefeated Indiana . it's hard not to look forward to the fall to see what college football does for an encore .

title: Reunions, new faces and promotions: Tracking the Power 4 coordinator moves
content: college football's coordinator carousel is often about the next big thing, the name you don't know yet but will soon enough . Chad Morris is back as offensive coordinator at Clemson . he helped engineer the program's rise alongside Dabo Swinney from 2011 to 2014 .

title: Liverpool summon grit, resolve that could carry them to Champions League places
content: liverpool beat sunderland 1-0 at the stadium of light on saturday . the hosts looked set to extend their impressive home record . Virgil van Dijk rising highest to nod home what would be the winning goal .

title: Welcome to the offseason: What you need to know about key dates, biggest questions
content: a third of the NFL could be seeking a new quarterback this offseason . the 2026 draft is projected to be particularly light at the position, and no stars are looming in free agency . teams can begin u.s. games in the coming weeks .

title: Tottenham job proved too big for Frank, but changing manager won't fix mess
content: 'FC TV' crew react to the 2-1 defeat to Newcastle united at the st james' stadium in the premier league last summer . the former Brentford manager made it back to the hotel where club officials used it as an example of the step up he had made to Spurs .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams land heading into All-Star Weekend
content: three teams, made up of american players and international players, go head-to-head in another tournament-style competition . a few new faces have been added to the coveted rosters, including jamal Murray and Chet Holmgren .

title: Baseball is back! The stars, teams and themes we can't wait to see
content: the new york Mets capped an offseason overhaul with a trade for ace Freddy Peralta . the defending champion los Angeles Dodgers made the biggest splash when they inked no. 1 free agent Kyle Tucker to a four-year, $240 million deal .

title: Delhi AQI turns very poor again; scattered rain expected after February 16
content: the air quality index (AQI) stood at 305 at 4pm, up from 271 (poor) at the same time on Tuesday . the last time the city recorded very poor air was on Feb 4, when the AQI was 339 . haziness and changing wind direction could have contributed to the dip in air quality .
